title: Ziskinberg
author: Ziskinberg
content: We really need to be extra careful these days as criminals are everywhere, just waiting for the right moment to strike and steal from us, including our precious Bitcoin. But in the case of this popular streamer with nearly 4 million followers, reports say she publicly revealed that she owned Bitcoin.I pulled this from an article while trying to figure out why she became a target for robbers.QuoteSiragusa has posted information about Bitcoin previously on social media, including information about her assets. So moral of the story is, never gave idea people that you are holding bitcoins as that would put you in danger, unless you are a person with a lot of bodyguards, but if you are just an ordinary person, its better to be safe than sorry. read the full story here. Popular streamer held at gunpoint at Houston home in cryptocurrency robberyQuoteThree suspects allegedly broke into the home of a popular content creator and demanded access to her cryptocurrency account, a spokesperson for the Houston Police Department told Chron. The three individuals were accused of forcing entry into Kaitlyn "Amouranth" Siragusa's home in Houston around 10:50 Sunday night. The suspects reportedly struck her with a pistol and demanded access to her cryptocurrency account, according to law enforcement. Kaitlyn Siragusa, a popular online streamer known as Amouranth, posted on X at the time of the incident that she was being held at gunpoint.

comments.author: Mia Chloe
comments.body: Quote from: Ziskinberg on March 05, 2025, 12:09:51 PMWe really need to be extra careful these days as criminals are everywhere, just waiting for the right moment to strike and steal from us, including our precious Bitcoin. But in the case of this popular streamer with nearly 4 million followers, reports say she publicly revealed that she owned Bitcoin........This is a basically one of the major reasons why I always Mark out the fact that there is no 100% Safeway to store your cryptocurrency including Bitcoin. Online you are faced with a lot of security threats ranging from hacks to scams and even phishing. Hence storing offline is a better option however it still has its own disadvantages attached too.Coins stored offline on probably a paper wallet or a hardware wallet are not 100% safe from burglary and theft and this is the major reason why it is important to keep your coins offline and private. It's difficult for you to get targeted when there is no intel on you.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Our strength should rely on what we do and have, the moment we expose it to the public then we have to given them a target to use in knowing our strength and weakness, some will think they are doing all these because of public recognition and to earn some respect and intimidate on others by flaunting their asset worth to the public, but not knowing that they are only doing harm to their own self, no any benefits in doing this, instead you will have to blame yourself just as in the case of the illustrated example.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: This is an identical story with  Why You Need to Keep Your Crypto Investment Discreet.  The person in question I don't know what she was thinking to display such online on a social account where she has a lot of fans and enemies; she was lucky she didn't get harmed, and how the story is speculated, some said she and her husband were able to fire a gun on one of the robbers before they escaped.

comments.author: JoyMarsha
comments.body: Social media is not a place to show off wealth. Any person who decides to show off wealth over there is trying to put his life in danger because not everyone on social media has a good heart. Some have bad intentions, looking for who they will scam, kill, and steal from.People should be mindful of how they disclose their wealth or things about them on social media because that place is not as friendly and welcoming as thought by some people.I feel bad each time I hear people talk about their accumulated wealth on social media because it feels like they don't know the kind of dangers they are inviting into their lives.

comments.body: Someone posted a similar story here ----> https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5534136.msg65128735#msg65128735In both cases, the bitcoin holdings were made public, along with the wallet they used, and with the information we make public using Instagram, posting any financial data would be a free gift to thieves to find out your balance or even cause you serious harm and damage.

comments.author: Donneski
comments.body: Quote from: Ziskinberg on March 05, 2025, 12:09:51 PMSo moral of the story is, never gave idea people that you are holding bitcoins as that would put you in danger, unless you are a person with a lot of bodyguards, but if you are just an ordinary person, its better to be safe than sorry. robberyQuote [/quote]Wether you've got the presence of heavy physical security protecting you from any form of physical attack all the time or not, it's a huge security mistake to publicly release statements that suggests you've got digital assets stashed somewhere. Such utterances directly or indirectly attracts both physical attacks and attacks from hackers who'll what to steal from you. As crypto enthusiasts, it's very important to be absolutely conscious of the information you let out so it doesn't negatively hit back at you. I hope we all learn from this incident and further improve our security mechanisms.
